page.title: 09 Rural Policeman & Farmers
page.content:
The upholding of law and order is the responsibility of the rural policeman.
He looks after a number of villages and farms;his work differs from that of the town policeman in many ways. He is responsible for seeing that all the rules are obeyed, if there is an out- break of a serious disease on the farms such as fowl pest,anthrax, foot & mouth or swine fever. He has to see that notices are displayed restricting entry to the farmland and restricting the movement of animals within certain areas & also that the afflicted animals are destroyed. Sheep have to be dipped twice a year to kill parasites and the policeman has to check that this is done properly.
